summary: A FedEx invoice dated December 16, 2002, detailing shipping charges for an account belonging to Jeffrey E. Epstein. The invoice lists numerous shipments sent from Epstein's New York address to various recipients across the US in November and December 2002, revealing a network of associates and contacts.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The primary account holder for this FedEx invoice; all shipments are billed to him and sent from his Madison Avenue address in New York.

persons.name: Allen
persons.context: Recipient of a FedEx Express Saver package sent from Epstein on November 14, 2002, delivered to Miami, FL.

persons.name: W. Doulon
persons.context: Recipient of a FedEx Priority Overnight package sent from Epstein on November 10, 2002, delivered to an address in New York, NY.

persons.context: Recipient of a FedEx Priority Overnight package sent from Epstein on December 3, 2002.

persons.context: Recipient of a FedEx Priority Overnight package sent from Epstein on December 9, 2002, to Marconi, OH.

persons.context: Recipient of a FedEx 2Day package sent from Epstein on December 9, 2002, delivered to New York, NY.

persons.name: Edwina Simmonds
persons.context: Recipient of multiple FedEx packages (Priority Overnight and Standard Overnight) sent from Epstein on December 9 and 10, 2002, delivered to New York, NY.

persons.name: Milton New Mexico Electric Co
persons.context: Recipient of a FedEx Priority Overnight envelope sent from Epstein on December 9, 2002, addressed to Lloyd Central.

persons.name: A. Emily
persons.context: Person who signed for a large FedEx Express Saver package sent from Epstein to Los Angeles, CA, on December 13, 2002.

connections.description: Epstein sent a FedEx Standard Overnight envelope to Dershowitz in December 2002, indicating a business or personal correspondence link.
Epstein sent a FedEx Standard Overnight envelope to Gell-Mann marked 'MG-M PERSONAL' in December 2002.
Epstein sent a FedEx Priority Overnight package to Abigail Wexner in December 2002.
Epstein sent multiple FedEx packages to G. Maxwell in December 2002, with one signed for by C. Maxwell.
Epstein sent multiple FedEx packages to Edwina Simmonds in December 2002.
A shipment was sent by Nick Simmons but billed to 'Epstein Interest', indicating a financial or business relationship.

events.title: FedEx shipment to Allen
events.description: A FedEx Express Saver package is sent from Jeffrey Epstein's New York address to Allen in Miami, FL.

events.title: FedEx shipment to Murray Gell-Mann
events.description: A FedEx Standard Overnight envelope marked 'MG-M PERSONAL' is sent from Epstein to Murray Gell-Mann.

events.title: FedEx shipment to Alan Dershowitz
events.description: A FedEx Standard Overnight envelope is sent from Epstein to attorney Alan Dershowitz in New York.

events.title: Third-party shipment billed to Epstein Interest
events.description: A large FedEx Priority Overnight package is sent by Nick Simmons to B. Bonnett at London Fog Company, with charges billed to 'Epstein Interest'.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's FedEx account (1144-2081-6) was active in late 2002, showing frequent shipping activity from his New York residence.
Recipients of packages included notable figures like attorney Alan Dershowitz, physicist Murray Gell-Mann, and Abigail Wexner.
Multiple packages were sent to individuals with the surname Maxwell, including G. Maxwell, during this period.
One shipment was sent by Nick Simmons but billed to 'Epstein Interest', indicating a shared financial account or business entity.
The invoice details 21 express shipments and 1 ground shipment totaling $444.19 in charges for the period.
